results.title: Principal Product Manager
results.description:
Principal Product Manager

Location: Remote

¬†

Job Summary

TCGplayer connects hobbyists and hobby businesses to communities. We relentlessly improve the exchange of things and thoughts that fuel passions, providing the most compelling destination and tools for collectible card game enthusiasts, sellers, and publishers in the U.S. Now we‚Äôre expanding our innovative products and services to the global $25B collectible hobby market.

As Principal Product Manager, you will leverage your past experience and success to act as a thought leader and driving force for one of TCGplayer‚Äôs critical product portfolios, intersecting customer needs with our business goals and aligning cross-departmental teams to deliver valuable results every day. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and evaluate initiatives that enhance our customers‚Äô lives.

Our team prides itself on a culture that fosters camaraderie, embraces diversity, and exudes passion. We are one of New York State‚Äôs 50 best employers and Fortune.com‚Äôs top 100 companies for women in the U.S.¬†

If you like delighting customers across the collectibles community and can clearly and persuasively articulate ‚ÄúWhy‚Äù something must get done, this is the job for you.¬†¬†

Impact You Will Make Here

Your insight, effort, and experience will contribute across 3 areas of responsibility:

  • Customer value: Evaluate, document, and socialize portfolio-level customer needs, value propositions, and user journeys; weight and prioritize competing user needs / values; define user stories, epics, experiential goals, and behavioral success requirements; integrate program-level roadmaps into a coherent, customer-focused portfolio and clearly communicate the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind it.

  • Business impact: Lead Portfolio ROI definitions and business and financial modeling processes; monitor portfolio performance, anticipating and addressing business impacts; lead evaluations, decisions, and modifications on pricing models and sources of revenue; socialize plans, progress, and outcomes at every level of the business.

  • Coordinated execution: Foster an environment where cross-team collaboration and proactive communication is second nature, working closely with technical, design, and business teammates to elicit solutions that meet our customers‚Äô needs, business goals, and internal team requirements; establish a transparent change management process, ruthlessly prioritizing to balance customer needs with operational constraints.

What You Bring to the Team

Your past experience should include accountability for program- and portfolio-level strategy and successful execution:

  • 10+ years of experience working as a Product Manager, designing and developing software solutions at a B2C company.
  • Mastery of product management and development methodologies, including Agile and contemporary customer- and design-centric practices, including the ability to establish standards and conventions for informed decisions, dependency management, and portfolio delivery.
  • Proficiency with quantitative reasoning and modeling, including metric-informed decisioning, portfolio pricing and revenue models, and designing project- to portfolio-level operating metrics and KPIs.
  • A relentless focus on customers and solving their needs, with experience deriving objectives from customer insights; a desire to regularly, directly interact with customers, and when appropriate, travel to meet with them, visit hobby stores, conventions, and TCGplayer HQ to gather a deep understanding of the hobbyist community.
  • A self-directed practice and ability to achieve results while proactively seeking out discussion and feedback from leadership, peers, and other team members on major deliverables, portfolio planning, and team processes.
  • Experience with product lines analogous to TCGplayer: primarily ecommerce marketplace and SMB SaaS experience (supply chain, data analytics, content, mobile apps, and finance and customer service tooling experience is also valuable).
  • Excellent communications skills with the ability to share complex concepts to a variety of audiences, both with internal team members and external customers; a bias towards operational scalability and documentation.
  • Strong technical skills with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development, mobile and web technologies, and data platforms; comfort with infrastructure and internal systems considerations for successful product development programs.
  • Undergraduate and/or graduate degrees in business, computer science, design, or related experience.

¬†

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience in a hobby, gaming, and/or collectibles community
  • Product management experience on a platform, marketplace, or other commerce product
    • Product Owner, Product Manager, or Scrum Master certification
What We Provide

Our benefits program is one of the most flexible and progressive in the country. Plus, benefits start on day one, so you have everything you need to make a stress-free transition to life at TCGplayer.

  • Comprehensive medical insurance with a variety of plan options to suit your needs
  • Dental and vision insurance
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO)
  • 100% company paid Family Leave
  • 401k plan with 4% match¬†
  • Free coaching, counseling and mental health services
  • 100% company paid life insurance¬†
  • Paid trips to work with remote teammates

¬†

TCGplayer.com is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

TCGplayer is the largest marketplace for trading card games in the world, with nearly 1 billion dollars in sales. Founded by Chedy Hampson & Ray Moore as a digital media platform within the collectible hobby space, we have grown from our initial roots working inside Syracuse-based hobby stores selling comic books, sports cards, CD‚Äôs, collectible cards, action figures, and tabletop games, into an expansive eCommerce marketplace that connects a global community of millions of buyers with tens of thousands of retailers. TCGplayer maintains the largest authoritative database of historical and current prices for the most popular trading card games, and this data powers and connects an entire industry of publishers, buyers, sellers, influencers & developers.

We have been ranked amongst New York State‚Äôs 50 best employers and Fortune.com‚Äôs top 100 companies for women in the U.S and certified a Great Place to Work by our employees 5 years in a row. Our entire team prides itself on creating a culture that fosters camaraderie, embraces diversity, and exudes passion. We believe every team member contributes to our success.

With the largest marketplace for collectible card games, in-store tools for local gaming stores and industry leading fulfillment center to deliver products from sellers to buyers, we bring our innovative technologies and customer focused approach to the $25B global collectibles hobby market.¬†

results.title: Senior Front End Developer (React)
results.description:
Our Senior Front End Developer will help take our web application and stack to the next level. We're looking for a dynamic engineer who is no stranger to building well-designed, performant and effective front end web applications that support complex business rules. You will start by learning from the experiences of our current team and our current offerings and become intimately familiar with our codebase. As you improve in your understanding of our business logic, you will contribute your front end experience by adding features to our existing web app, which supports thousands of customers.

What You'll Do
  • Contribute to new and existing projects by developing and maintaining a reliable set of edge applications
  • Partner with UX and Product Management to translate complex business flows into friendly UI experiences
  • Build shared microservices that can serve multiples applications and scale independently
  • Enable our team to tap into our valuable data sources and build incredible features for our customers
  • Provide constructive feedback on pull requests to increase code quality
Your First 90 Days

In your First 30 Days,¬†you will immerse yourself in our team, tech stack and development culture. You will work with your Lead to better understand our web app offering. You will help implement our front end technical roadmap, which takes scalability, testing, and performance into account, and present a gap analysis on what can be done even better. You will take on development items, getting your hands in our current web stack (75-90% of your time).¬†

In your First 60 Days,¬†along with user stories and product features, you will help work on a backlog of technical infrastructure work identified in your First 30 Days. You will help drive an efficient and effective SDLC and work to learn and better support your Scrum Team (Product Management, QA, fellow Developers).¬†

In your First 90 Days, you will help instill the discipline of effectively monitoring and creating work items from production issues.¬†You will further our tech stack by continuing to help implement our technical roadmap and future deliveries. You will further play a meaningful role in helping hire future members of our growing Product Team.¬†

Who You Are
  • 5+ years' experience developing single-page web applications
  • Depth of experience with React or other modern front end frameworks (e.g., Angular, Vue)
  • Ability to flesh out user stories to be consumed by the rest of your team
  • Experience working in an Agile environment (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to collaborate with remote team members
  • Excellent technical design, problem-solving and debugging skills
Your Differentiators
  • Prior experience with C# or Java
  • Bachelor's in Computer Science preferred

Our Values

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.
  • We do the right thing and have fun in the process.

The salary range for this opportunity is $130,000 - $140,000 per year. You will be eligible for discretionary bonus compensation, subject to plans that may be in effect from time to time. You will further be eligible to participate in Unanet's employee benefits plans and programs. For more details on Unanet's benefits offerings, please visit https://unanet.com/employee-benefits.

Unanet is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for positions without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Head of Development
results.description:
About Swing Left

Swing Left is a national grassroots organization working to elect Democrats up and down the ballot. We make it possible for anyone to make an impact on the elections that determine the balance of power in our country, by volunteering in and donating to key races. Since launching in 2017, Swing Left volunteers have raised $80 million for Democratic candidates, civic organizations, and voter mobilization efforts, and made more than 44 million combined phone calls, door knocks, and letters sent to voters via our affiliate Vote Forward and their partners.

About Vote Forward

Vote Forward is a 501(c)(4) nonprofit organization that builds tools to encourage Americans to vote. We work to increase the participation of traditionally underrepresented groups in the electorate, and to increase civic engagement among the public at large, by supporting the volunteers working to engage these voters. Since 2018, more than 250,000 grassroots volunteers have used the Vote Forward platform to send handwritten letters to more than 25 million prospective voters to encourage them to register to vote and turn out for elections. Vote Forward is closely affiliated with Swing Left, and Vote Forward staff work with Swing Left on many projects of mutual interest.

Overview

The primary responsibility of the Head of Development is to ensure Swing Left and Vote Forward have the financial resources necessary to execute their missions by leading the development and implementation of major donor and grassroots fundraising strategies in support of the organizations' annual operating budgets, as well as fundraising strategies for Swing Left target candidates and civic organizations. This role reports to the Managing Director and is an at-will position.

The Swing Left and Vote Forward team is fully remote, but there is an expectation for the Head of Development to attend in-person meetings and events in various locations around the country. Candidates should have the ability to travel regularly (approximately 5-8 days per month on average).

We aim to begin interviews for this position by early February. We expect to review the first batch of applications by January 20 and then will do a rolling review of applications until the position is filled and/or the application is closed. Please note that our office is closed between December 17 ‚Äì January 2.

Responsibilities¬†

Lead the development, implementation, and execution of major donor and grassroots fundraising strategies for Swing Left and Vote Forward

  • Lead the development and implementation of cross-cutting fundraising strategies to drive goals‚Äì‚Äìoperational fundraising for Swing Left and Vote Forward, and fundraising for targeted candidates, campaigns and organizations, including via Blueprint
  • Directly manage the Development team, including consultants and full-time staff
  • Oversee the development and iterations of Blueprint, determine strategies for allocations, and work cross-functionally to maintain and grow its audience
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to develop and implement digital fundraising strategies with the Marketing team
  • Lead the assessment of the organization's existing strategies to identify priorities for program development and updates, and identify, develop, and implement new and improved strategies for fundraising¬†
  • Establish goals for fundraising, define systems and processes to measure success and track progress toward goals and work cross functionally to develop and implement strategies for meeting goals¬†

Oversee and lead the development, implementation, and execution of major donor strategy for Swing Left and Vote Forward and, in partnership with the Executive Director and rest of the development team, manage relationships with the organizations' major donors

  • Develop and implement fundraising strategies that will allow Swing Left and Vote Forward to accomplish their respective organizational goals
  • Oversee the research of potential major donors to gain insights into needs, beliefs, and donation habits to understand how to engage them in donating to Swing Left and Vote Forward
  • Identify, contact, and follow up with existing and prospective donors to provide information necessary for engagement
  • Develop programs that will engage and retain new and existing donors
  • Develop fundraising messages and collateral that are compelling to potential donors and consistent with the Swing Left and Vote Forward brands
  • Work with the Executive Director and development team to set fundraising goals and report on progress¬†
  • Work with the Executive Director and development team to build and strengthen relationships with donors and donor prospects
  • Organize campaigns and events that will lead to soliciting donors and/or in coordination with donors
  • Develop a process and structure for maintaining records of donor information and ensure accuracy of donor information
  • Develop and evaluate success of fundraising efforts and events and make adjustments to strategy as necessary
  • Develop donor and legal reporting documentation to ensure requirements are satisfied

Serve as a member of the organization's leadership team: collaborate with other leadership team members and executive leadership to analyze feedback from staff, identify areas of improvement, establish org-wide priorities and programs, and coordinate to ensure the success of cross-functional initiatives

Successful Head of Development candidates will have
  • A strong interest in Swing Left's mission and values
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills that demonstrate an ability to convey a compelling understanding of Swing Left and Vote Forward's mission and impact, and translate our data, research and analysis on strategy and electoral impact into persuasive narratives
  • At least 2 ‚Äì 3 cycles (4 ‚Äì 6 years) of increasing responsibility in a fundraising environment, with a proven track record of securing significant gifts from individuals, organizations, foundations, etc.¬†
  • Experience leading the creation and implementation of effective and successful donor cultivation and engagement programs
  • Experience with major donor fundraising in electoral, 501c(3), and 501c(4) contexts
  • Strongly prefer experience with digital fundraising in electoral, 501c(3), and 501c(4) contexts
  • Mastery of donor, principal, and key stakeholder relationship-building and management
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively across teams in a remote environment
  • Ability to work under pressure and balance multiple priorities at once
  • Ability to diagnose problems quickly and foresee potential issues, and a strong solutions orientation
  • Demonstrated success managing and leading staff and building an impact-driven, collaborative team culture
  • A demonstrated commitment to equity and belonging across all identities including but not limited to race, gender, sexual orientation, age and ability. A specific track record of a commitment to BIPOC communities.¬†
  • A keen interest in being an intentional organizational leader, trusted thought partner to executive leadership, and critical individual contributor¬†
Working at Swing Left

The Development Lead position is a full-time, exempt and remote position. There is regular travel expected for this role (see more information in the Overview section of this posting). The pay range for this position is $148,565 ‚Äì $165,073 on an annualized basis. We provide cost of living compensation increases at the beginning of each year.¬†

In addition to health, dental, vision, and retirement benefits, Swing Left's benefits package includes a professional development fund, a remote work fund, and a technology stipend for all employees. We have an unlimited time-off policy, a flexible medical and parental leave policy, and our office is closed for approximately 25 business days each year. We are happy to answer any questions you have about our benefits and policies in interviews.

We are an equal opportunity employer and seek applications from all qualified candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas at this time.¬†

We welcome all applicants regardless of age, citizenship, gender identity or expression, national origin, pregnancy status, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other differences.

Please note the best way to express interest in this position is to submit an application‚Äì‚Äìthis is the most effective way for our team to review and process applications fairly and efficiently.

results.title: SEO and Content Marketing Expert Writer
results.description:
Growth Machine is seeking an outstanding writer who is well-versed in SEO and content marketing to work with us on an exciting new content project.

Requirements

For this project, you'll create long form (1,200-1,500 word), informational, SEO-friendly articles for the client's blog. We will provide you with keyword research and some training, but you should come to the table with a good working knowledge of the subject matter, the willingness to research any topics you need a little more information, and the ability to write engaging and informative, yet approachable articles about topics like keyword research, backlinks and site authority, and content marketing best practices.

Benefits

Since this is a freelance position, there are no benefits. The project pays a flat rate per article, and assuming we work well together, there is significant opportunity for future work, if you'd like to grow with us.

results.title: Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting
results.description:
Company Description

KIPP Public Schools is a national network of public charter schools that prepares students with the skills and confidence to create the future they want for themselves, their communities, and us all.‚ÄØWe are a network of 270 schools, nearly 10,000 educators, and more than 160,000 students and alumni.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

‚ÄØ¬†
Our mission: Together with families and communities, we create joyful, academically excellent schools that prepare students with the skills and confidence to pursue the paths they choose‚Äîcollege, career, and beyond‚Äîso they can lead fulfilling lives and build a more just world.‚ÄØ¬†

‚ÄØ¬†

Our vision: Every child grows up free to create the future they want for themselves and their communities.‚ÄØ¬†

‚ÄØ¬†

The KIPP Foundation is a nonprofit organization that supports KIPP schools across the country. The KIPP Foundation trains and develops outstanding educators to lead KIPP public schools; provides tools, resources and training for excellent teaching and learning; promotes innovation; and facilitates the exchange of insights and ideas across KIPP and other public schools and organizations.‚ÄØ¬†



Job Description

About The Position¬†

As the‚ÄØSenior‚ÄØManager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, you will be a key member of KIPP Foundation‚Äôs Network Talent Team, contributing to our team purpose to build and sustain healthy talent ecosystems within KIPP regions. You will support our strategy to build KIPP regions‚Äô capacity to recruit and hire excellent, anti-racist teachers and leaders, ensuring that schools are 80% hired by the last day of school. You will partner closely with over 25 regions to create and iterate on the resources that support 125+ recruiters across the country, including the codified KIPP Recruitment Playbook that outlines research-backed best practices. You will also be the product manager for the network-wide Applicant Tracking System, helping our KIPP regions develop data monitoring systems that lead to equitable hiring practices and a diverse teacher workforce.¬†

¬†

Responsibilities¬†

As the Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, you will be responsible for:¬†

¬†

Strategy Development‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†¬†

  • In collaboration with the Director, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, codify and define best practices for recruitment and selection of teachers and leaders to ensure schools are 80% hired by the last day of school¬†

  • Conduct research, synthesize findings and make recommendations on effective and equitable recruitment practices¬†

  • Lead process to revise and project manage the KIPP Recruitment Playbook, managing workload across the team and ensuring playbook publication strategy meets regional needs¬†

  • Support in designing the strategy to develop KIPP‚Äôs regional recruiters and recruitment team managers¬†¬†

  • Collaborate with all team members to continuously identify opportunities for improvement and increased efficiency in cross-team work¬†

‚ÄØ¬†¬†

Management and Execution‚ÄØ¬†¬†

  • Partner with regions to build their recruitment systems and practices so that they create robust and equitable recruitment pipelines¬†¬†

  • Lead project management for revisions to the Playbook and other resources that support regional recruiter development¬†¬†

  • Lead communications with recruitment community, including monthly newsletter, requests for data collection, updates on tools, etc.‚ÄØ¬†¬†

  • Product manage the KIPP recruitment tools, including our Applicant Tracking System, staffing plan, exemplars and templates for the Playbook; iterate on existing tools to align with research and best practices¬†

  • Support the planning of virtual learning sessions for regional recruiters to track data, get training on the use of recruitment tools, and share network-wide lessons learned‚ÄØ¬†

  • Manage network-wide contracts with outside vendors and relevant communications with regions¬†¬†

  • Design approach to measuring impact and adjust solutions based on data‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†¬†

‚ÄØ¬†¬†

Team Leadership‚ÄØ¬†¬†

  • Contribute to cohesive execution of the team vision and collaboration across the team and the overall KIPP Foundation‚ÄØ¬†

  • Connect with teammates to ensure coordination across the team, in service of our regions; look across the KIPP Foundation to ensure collaboration and cohesion of strategy; work effectively across lines of difference to drive our goals for equitable talent systems across the KIPP network¬†

¬†

Skills¬†¬†

  • Tool & Product Development: Excellent product manager who can lead a product management process to create valuable, research-based, user-friendly, high-use tools¬†

  • Planning & Execution: Skilled at project management; able to own a project plan from kick-off to close-out, driving multiple competing priorities forward‚ÄØ¬†

  • Critical Thinking & Problem Solving: Adept at problem solving and critical thinking; able to structure analyses, formulate hypotheses, gather and synthesize data, develop and assess alternatives and build a case for recommendations‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†¬†

  • Stakeholder Management & Communication: Strong stakeholder manager who can build and engage in productive relationships with regional leaders to inform product development and refinement; can effectively communicate to stakeholders both verbally and in written form¬†

  • Mission & Student Focus: Deep commitment to both racial and educational equity; supports the building of an organization that reflects the community KIPP serves; holds self and others accountable for centering equity¬†¬†

  • Cultural Competence & Commitment to Equity: A proactive cultural leader and team player who thrives on collaboration and learning; can effectively collaborate with teammates across lines of difference¬†



Qualifications

Experience and Qualifications¬†

  • 5+ years of relevant work experience operating in product development and/or management and/or knowledge management, ideally for a school system or in an education nonprofit¬†¬†

  • Experience in the field of talent strategy highly preferred, including deep functional knowledge of recruitment processes and systems¬†¬†¬†

  • Track record of successful project management including the execution of on time work and ability to collaborate successfully with teammates and other partners¬†¬†

  • Experience with an Applicant Tracking System a plus (SmartRecruiters, Salesforce, Workday, etc)¬†

¬†

Work Conditions¬†

  • The Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting will report to the Director, Talent & Recruitment Consulting¬†

  • Travel requirements: Up to 10%¬†

  • Full-time, exempt role¬†



Additional Information

Work Conditions¬†

Willingness to travel frequently (10-12 days monthly and 4-6 consecutive weeks during the summer), including some weekends¬†

¬†

Location¬†

It is preferred, but not mandatory for this role to be based out of Washington DC given the focus on event planning in Policy and Public Affairs.‚ÄØ This role also has the option of working from a remote office full time.‚ÄØ KIPP Foundation office is in NYC, Chicago, San Francisco, and Washington DC.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

¬†

Compensation and Benefits
KIPP offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience. Our comprehensive benefits package include:

  • 20 vacation days + 18 days additional flexible PTO days (flexible PTO increases to 23 days for year 3 and 4 and to 28 days for years 5+).
  • 100% paid parental leave
  • 100% coverage of the premium for employee and 75% for employee + family‚Äôs medical/dental/vision plans.
  • Wellness benefits such as fitness reimbursements, discounted tickets to theme parks/attraction, back-up care support for children and adults/elders, and our employee assistance program
  • Finance Security benefits include such as a 401K retirement plan with 4% match, employer sponsored legal plans, and life/disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts
  • ¬†

‚ÄØ¬†

¬†

KIPP Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and an organization that values diversity. People from all diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.¬†

¬†

At HENI we believe in the importance of art, and the power of technology to radically advance and democratize the art industry. Our mission is to make art accessible to everyone, by engaging with and innovating within all aspects of its creation and distribution.

HENI prides itself on a connection with and commitment to cutting-edge technology across all our platforms. This is exemplified by our NFT Studio and marketplace, which have launched several fine art NFTs to date, starting with Damien Hirst‚Äôs The Currency. The Currency NFT collection has been very successful, with over $90M+ USD of secondary market trading since 27 July 2021, a significant amount of which has gone through the HENI NFT marketplace.

But HENI is much more than NFT‚Äôs!

HENI has a history in the physical art world and has developed platforms that focus on trading art, art education, art production, and publishing.

We also develop apps that use huge quantities of art-related data from across the globe. These apps are both web and mobile and use a variety of machine learning techniques to sort through and make sense of the data. Once launched recently was HENI News, an art news aggregation service.

Moreover, HENI also has a number of interactive and dynamic customer-facing websites, including e-commerce and streaming services.

Everything we develop is in-house and we have very strong engineering and data teams to make all this possible.

¬†

Technology at HENI

Our growing technical team contains a set of very capable Engineers, Data Scientists, DevOps, and supporting staff. We constantly tackle new and challenging problems ‚Äì some of these solutions have involved developing our own in-house tools using machine learning, artificial intelligence, and augmented reality. Utilising modern cloud infrastructure and coding practices, we pride ourselves on exceeding the expectations of internal and external stakeholders. Using the very best tools, frameworks, and programming standards, including TDD, BDD, and Acceptance Criteria Testing, we aim to create a technical team that leads by example and excels in clean, readable, and modular code.

¬†

Position overview

We are looking to recruit a Senior Security Specialist; this specialist will be responsible for the full security spectrum with regard to technology within the business.

Your background

results.title: Sales Executive - Gaming SAAS
results.description:
We are Gfinity! An¬†esports operator & technology company serving some of the largest brands on the planet - the Premier league, Formula1, Redbull, NVIDIA, Nintendo, and many more.¬† Over the past 10 years, we've pioneered the world's most powerful tournament platform able to serve hundreds of thousands of concurrent competitors across thousands of simultaneous events.¬† We are now using this foundational technology to create a fully self-serviced product for game studios and web publishers to leverage the power of competition to drive gamer retention, engagement, and value.

We are looking for a passionate gamer and sales expert, someone who is enthusiastic to drive our go to market plan, engage with gaming developers, research and create an action plan and have experience with generating new business.

You will play an active role in helping us craft the go-to-market strategy for the new product, owning the sales development process, and driving sales of the products into the game services market. You will work with game publishers, game developers and game services platforms involved in creating the technology infrastructure for games in the emerging space of Live Operations within the broader gaming eco-system.¬†

You ideally bring strong knowledge of the gaming infrastructure service and development cycle and both platform or SaaS sales processes.¬†You probably have prior experience with an established SaaS company or a start-up, or game services/infrastructure companies, or a game development studio.

Key Responsibilities:

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
We are ThinkShout, a fully distributed, certified B Corp dedicated to delivering exceptional web development, design, user experience, and strategy to the nonprofits and forward-thinking organizations that inspire us.

We're looking for a Senior Product Designer to lead project work, inspire our clients, and engage in shaping our design team in a time of critical department growth.. User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and inspiring communication. You‚Äôll collaborate with fellow designers and departments to create innovative design solutions that have a greater impact for our clients.

Requirements

Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of relevant industry experience, designing large-scale websites and engaging digital products
  • A visual thinker with strong color, typographic, and UX/UI skills with a knack for design systems
  • Advanced level of proficiency with design programs like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Knowledge of how designs are applied in HTML and CSS as well as CMS platforms; Wordpress and Drupal are a plus
  • A deep understanding of accessible, inclusive and user-centered design practices
  • An awareness of the inherent white supremacy of design thinking and actively making efforts to decolonize one‚Äôs individual design practice
  • Strong communication skills, ability to present and defend work to peers and executive-level stakeholders
  • Experience working with existing brands and design systems in order to maintain brand voice and visual identity; Brand design experience a plus
  • Experience creating reusable components & design patterns to scale and fit variety of content and technical requirements as well as in-line with project budgets
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and an agile self-starter, able to contribute to projects with varying levels of direction, and pivot flexibly as project plans shift

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Creating, organizing, and documenting all your designs in Figma with extreme detail
  • Managing your time between projects of varying size and complexity with a dedicated focus to elevating your craft

Benefits

The Fine Print

ThinkShout is a fully distributed company and we welcome applications from candidates who have the unrestricted right to work in the USA.

ThinkShout is primarily a time and materials agency. In the role of Senior Product Designer, there is a weekly expectation of 30 billable hours. We work hard to maintain a 40 hour work week and we‚Äôre committed to supporting flexible schedules.

The salary band for this position is $80-105k. In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:

  • Health insurance with dental, vision, and alternative care
  • Company funded Health Reimbursement Account
  • 401k with a 3% company contribution and no matching requirement
  • Quarterly Profit Share program
  • Life insurance and short term disability insurance
  • Paid Family and Medical Leave
  • 32 days of PTO annually, including holidays
  • Paid sabbatical after 5 years with the company
  • Professional development funds
  • Excellent management support and a well thought-out yearly review process


ThinkShout is made up of people with a variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We recognize that our company isn't as diverse as it should be and we're trying to change that. If you aren't sure whether you qualify, please apply anyway. We would much prefer to have an extra application to consider than for you to screen yourself out. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better (jobs@thinkshout.com). We are happy to accommodate.


Next Steps

Please submit a resume (no more than 2 pages) in PDF format. We request that you do not submit a cover letter. In its place, we have a few questions for you to answer in the job application. These questions will help us learn more about you and are an integral component of the interview process.

If you are selected to move forward, here‚Äôs what you can expect:

  • Round 1 is a 25-minute screening call
  • Round 2 is a 55-minute panel interview in which you will present a project from your portfolio followed by a Q&A
  • Round 3 is a 45-minute finalist interview

We are looking to fill this position for a January start date.

Please note that candidates must reside and be eligible to work in the United States.
